required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Sleep Education for Elders Program Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: This study tests the effectiveness of a new educational intervention designed to improve sleep outcomes among an older adult population.

study_design_info.masking_description: Analyses will be done by blinded assessor.

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep quality: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
primary_outcome.description: Change in sleep quality as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. Scores range from 0-21 with higher scores representing worse outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Sleep quality: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
primary_outcome.description: Change in sleep quality as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index. Scores range from 0-21 with higher scores representing worse outcomes.
Change in sleep duration (hours and minutes) as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
Change in sleep duration (hours and minutes) as measured by Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
Change in daytime sleepiness measured by Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Scale scoring ranges from 0-24, with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
Change in daytime sleepiness measured by Epworth Sleepiness Scale. Scale scoring ranges from 0-24, with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after the program and six months later
primary_outcome.description: As measured by Insomnia Severity Index. Scores range from 0-28 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Insomnia Severity Index. Scores range from 0-28 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Sleep Hygiene Index. Scores range from 0-52 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.
As measured by Sleep Hygiene Index. Scores range from 0-52 with higher scores indicating worse outcomes.

secondary_outcome.description: As measured by several questions related to sleep health and hygiene
As measured by several questions related to sleep health and hygiene

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep satisfaction: questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep satisfaction: questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by questions measuring personal satisfaction with sleep quality and duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Program satisfaction: questions and comments related to program experiences
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by questions and comments related to program experiences

secondary_outcome.measure: Program satisfaction: questions and comments related to program experiences
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by questions and comments related to program experiences

arm_group.description: Participants who participated in the SLEEP program.
Participants who did not participate in the SLEEP program.

intervention.description: SLEEP is a 6-week educational program designed to improve sleep hygiene and habits.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- participants who choose to enroll in the SLEEP program
Exclusion Criteria:
- younger than 40 years of age
